text.text: What is the purpose of the Insurance Finder feature in ZOLL Billing?

text: The Insurance Finder feature in ZOLL Billing helps determine if the patient's insurance information is accurate prior to billing. It can also show other payers for the patient. When you click Find insurance, ZOLL Billing will take your saved patient information and reach out to all the payers in your area to find coverage. When coverage is found, you can save the payer information to the patient's account with a few button clicks.

text.text: How does Insurance Finder help in ensuring accurate insurance information before billing?

text: Insurance Finder helps determine if the patient's insurance information is accurate before billing. It can also show other payers for the patient. When you click Find insurance, ZOLL Billing will take your saved patient information and reach out to all the payers in your area to find coverage. When coverage is found, you can save the payer information to the patient's account with a few button clicks.

text.text: Can you explain the process of using the Insurance Finder feature in ZOLL Billing?

text: To run Insurance Finder, you can go to the claim creation page or the Claim page and look for it under the Coordination of Benefits tab. When you click Find insurance, ZOLL Billing will take your saved patient information and reach out to all the payers in your area to find coverage. When coverage is found, you can save the payer information to the patient's account with a few button clicks.

text.text: Where can users access the Insurance Finder feature within the ZOLL Billing interface?

text: To run Insurance Finder, you can go to the claim creation page or the Claim page and look for it under the Coordination of Benefits tab. When you click Find insurance, ZOLL Billing will take your saved patient information and reach out to all the payers in your area to find coverage. When coverage is found, you can save the payer information to the patient's account with a few button clicks.

text.text: What information does ZOLL Billing use to run the Insurance Finder?

text: ZOLL Billing uses the patient's saved information to run Insurance Finder. This includes information such as the patient's name, date of birth, and social security number. ZOLL Billing also uses the patient's insurance information to run Insurance Finder.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing communicate with payers to find coverage using the Insurance Finder?

text: ZOLL Billing uses the patient's saved information to run Insurance Finder. This includes information such as the patient's name, date of birth, and social security number. ZOLL Billing also uses the patient's insurance information to run Insurance Finder. When you click Find insurance, ZOLL Billing will take your saved patient information and reach out to all the payers in your area to find coverage. When coverage is found, you can save the payer information to the patient's account with a few button clicks.

text.text: What kind of results does the Insurance Finder display after searching for coverage?

text: The Insurance Finder displays the address and Medicare number from the Insurance Discovery. It also displays the claim number, service date, patient's name and address, and the claim's balance.

text.text: How can users add a found payer to a patient's account using the Insurance Finder results?

text: To add a found payer to a patient's account, click Add to COB. If this is a new payer, click the New link. To fill out the fields in this screen, click More info to view the subscriber information. Clicking this link opens the active coverage sheet in a separate tab.

text.text: Are there any specific steps or considerations when dealing with Railroad Medicare coverage?

text: Because all Railroad Medicare claims go through Palmetto GBA, the system automatically displays information for Palmetto on the claim's COB.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle cases where a patient is in hospice care?

text: If the file retrieved by Insurance Discovery shows that the patient is in Hospice for your date of service, the system will display that information in a banner at the top of the search results page.

text.text: Can users manually add a payer to a patient's account if it's not found through the Insurance Finder?

text: To manually add a payer to a patient's account, you can run Insurance Discovery on the COB tab by clicking Find insurance. If Insurance Discovery finds a red flag, warning, or low confidence score, you will be alerted.

text.text: Are there any limitations or restrictions to using the Insurance Finder feature?

text: Insurance Finder helps to determine if the patient's insurance information is accurate prior to billing and, if it exists, show other payers for this patient. It may also be necessary to identify replacement payers, third party liability, remaining deductible, or any additional information that may indicate a different payer should be billed.

text.text: How often does ZOLL Billing update its database of payers and coverage information?

text: ZOLL Billing comes pre-configured with a list of Medicare payers. The list is managed and updated by ZOLL.

text.text: What are the benefits of using the Insurance Finder feature for billing and revenue management processes?

text: When you click Find insurance, ZOLL Billing will take your saved patient information and reach out to all the payers in your area to find coverage. When coverage is found, you can save the payer information to the patient's account with a few button clicks.
